Report E-2023090003

  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of acetone (un1090) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon can had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090000
item.description:
Report E-2023090000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: ODESSA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LMD experienced a UN1992 CORR21262WR release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released impacting a 20’ x 20’ area of the concrete dock floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The salvaged product was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023081014
item.description:
Report E-2023081014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023 at 1408 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo , Texas regarding the release of approximately (10) gallons of Yellow 30C236 in HV4187-Polycon (UN1263, Paint, 3, III) I) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080994
item.description:
Report E-2023080994

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 1044-pound UN2794 Battery, filled with acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released impacting an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 5’ x 3’ area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading. The impacted areas were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate and then collected with absorbents. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged battery was shrink wrapped with absorbent pads and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

EACH BATTERY IN EACH BOX HAD LEAKED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1Z8V23190141104686. THERMAL LABEL REFERENCE SECTION HAS AN ITEM DESCRIPTION OF BATTERIES 120AH.

item.title: Report X-2023080870
item.description:
Report X-2023080870

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A member of our hazmat Team Noticed Improper handling had occurred when he got there, leakage was noted. Afterwards our team member grabbed a damage tote and separated the Package so as to prevent additional damage to other packages. DescribePack: Two pinpoint holes on the bottom corners of the Package on opposite sides as well as loose caps and sealing. These factors led to package Leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Package was segregated to prevent leakage opportunity to damage other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023080855
item.description:
Report X-2023080855

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080855 SequenceEvent: Unloading in door 7 tr# 808374. 7 haz-mats stacked on to of each other and orientation arrows pointing the wrong direction. Two hazmats leaked, and 5 need repacks. PPE used blue gloves, i removed the leaking hazmats and placed them into lined hazmat totes for further processing. DescribePack: incorrect loading onto Trailor DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed leaking hazmats into lines red tote. 2. X-2023080858 SequenceEvent: unload door 7 tr#687546184282 7 haz-mats stacked on top of each other with the orientation arrows, two of them leaked out and damaging 5 other hazmat's (need to repack them). PPE used gloves and goggles. I removed all 7 leaking and damaged hazmat's and placed them into lines red totes for processing. DescribePack: Improper loading of hazmat's onto TR by Dallas DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed leaking hazmat into red lined hazmat tote.

Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down. DescribePack: Package had a loose cap and was placed onto its side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down.

item.title: Report E-2023090050
item.description:
Report E-2023090050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, fifteen (15) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in using hand tools. The crew then removed all impacted cardboard and plywood debris from the trailer. All clean up material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The fifteen (15) damaged one-gallon pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Borth drums were left onsite for further evaluation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet while unloading from the trailer. Package was taken to the hazmat cage and placed in a red hazmat bin with pads underneath to mitigate the release. DescribePack: Cause of failure was a loose cap on one of the four 5L plastic jugs. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were placed in the hazmat bin underneath the damaged package.

item.title: Report E-2023080997
item.description:
Report E-2023080997

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed during transit and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the adjacent plywood. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. E3 personnel collected the damaged pail, then deployed absorbent pads to collect the released product. The crew then containerized all paint impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1213 was damaged during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. E3 personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All waste was secured in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report I-2023080047
item.description:
Report I-2023080047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: LONGVIEW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: On July 2, 2023 at approximately 7:15 PM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on State Highway 42 in Gregg County, TX. At the intersection of Hwy 42 and Texaco Rd, a 2012 Nissan traveling east on Texaco Rd failed to stop at a stop sign and collided with Plains transport, causing the tank trailer to separate from the tractor and roll over into the ditch. Upon separation, the landing gear broke off and punctured a 3x3 inch hole in the trailer, at the 7 o'clock position if upright, but upon roll over, puncture was located at the 10 o'clock position. As a result of the collision, 70 gallons of diesel from the transport fuel tank and approximately 2 gallons of hydraulic fluid, from the trailer hydraulic pump and lines, were released to the roadway and roadside ditch. The Plains vehicle and the other vehicle were non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. An absorbent was applied to the roadway to encapsulate the diesel and hydraulic fluid, then swept and contained in 55 gallon drums. The impacted roadside ditch has been excavated to remove impacted soil and manifested for disposal, in accordance with TCEQ clean-up criteria. . . The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility. Occupant of other vehicle perished at the scene.

item.title: Report E-2023080603
item.description:
Report E-2023080603

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 22nd, 2023, SkyWest flight UA4691 was traveling from Oklahoma City to Houston. While on final approach passenger Ronnie Prince’s Apple MagSafe device went into thermal runaway. The SkyWest flight attendant responded to the fire with the halon fire extinguisher. The flight landed and the fire department responded to the aircraft. Passenger was treated for burn to hands and transported to the hospital via Life Flight. The device is reported to be an Apple MagSafe battery pack, passenger took the device with him and will not talk to SkyWest or United Airlines.
